homeIntroHeading1: How well do you know the elderly person?
homeIntroHeading2: How do you make sure that the person can have meaningful activities today?
homeIntroText: This digital learing solution is designed to promote the knowledge of how you can easily find out the elderly's life story and how to support the persons Sence of Coherense (SOC) with meaningful activities in daily life.
homeEnables: It enables students and staff to:
homeList: increase the understanding of a person-centered mindset
visualize what the person finds meaningful
find out new things that the person is interested in
quickly and easily support the person in components that promotes quality of life
encourage the person to attend in meaningful activities in daily life
homePartnerships: This webbpage is a digital showcase that is a part of the Erasmus+ D-LIGHT Network that is a partnership between SOSU Nord (Denmark), Tallinn Health Care College (Estonia), Yrkesinstitutet Prakticum (Finland), ROC da Vinci College (the Netherlands), and Calasanz Santurtzi S.L. (Spain/Euskadi). Together, we identify innovative digital learning solutions to shared European challenges in preparing for tomorrow’s Care and Rehabilitation Services for Senior Citizens.​

lifeFirstBanner: How well do you know the elderly person?
lifeSection0FirstTextWhy: By listening to the elderlys life story - you can better understand the elderly´s situation, what the person wants and needs. This gives you the possibility to provide meaningful choices for the elderly person in everyday life based on the person´s interests.
lifeSection0SecondHeadExpert: The elderly person is an expert on:
lifeSection0ListSecond: their own feelings, thoughts, habits, wishes, abilities and values
lifeSection0ThirdHeadTools: The Life Story gives you tools to:
lifeSection0ListThird: find out the persons background, interests and participation
work in an individual and person-centered way
see the person behind the disease or the diagnosis
draw your attention to the things that are important in the person´s life
lifeSection0FourthHeadTraining: For training this topic the student/participant must already posses the following key skills and basic knowledge about:
lifeSection0ListFourth: the positive health model or similar framework highlighting the holistic connection between physical, mental and social health
lifeSection1Banner: 1. How do you find out the persons life story, background and interests?
lifeSection1Text: Click on the persons play button and listen to their life story.
lifeSection2Banner: 2. Fill in the Tree of Life
lifeSection2Text:
1. Use the attached Tree of life and fill in a summary of the persons life story.

2. When you have filled in the Tree of life, download the PDF to your computer and submit it to your teacher.

3. You will use the Tree of life to choose suitable activities later on.
lifeSection3TextInfo: Participate in a workshop where Tree of life is presented and discussed. Your teacher will give you further information of the date and time for this workshop.
lifeSection3List: What the person likes and enjoy
What the persons dreams, hopes and wishes for
What the person is afraid of
What are the persons favorite things (for example food, interests, animals and so on)
What is important for the person
Important life events for the person
Who is a part of the person´s network (for example family and friends)
meaningfulFirstBanner: How do you make sure that the person can have meaningful activities today?
meaningfulSection0FirstTextWhy: By suggesting meaningful activities, you can promote the persons Sence of Cohesence (SOC). When you listen to the persons feelings and mood today, you will be able to take into account the elderlys daily resourses and thereby provide activities that are suitable and feels important for the person.
meaningfulSection0SecondHeadTraining: For training this topic the student/participant must already posses the following key skills and basic knowledge about:
meaningfulSection0List: the positive health model or similar framework highlighting the holistic connection between physical, mental and social health
how to guide daily functioning with a resource-oriented approach
how to promote a meaningful life by using methods that increase participation
meaningfulSection1Banner: 1. Choose meaningful activites based on the elderly person´s interests
meaningfulSection1Text: Once you have completed the Three of life, choose meaningful activities based on your information from the person´s life story.
meaningfulSection1SecondHead: Choose different options by clicking on the themes:
meaningfulSection1SecondText: When you have chosen, the webbpage will give you ideas for possible activities within the chosen themes.
meaningfulSection2Banner: 2. Choose an activity for today, based on the person´s mood:
meaningfulSection2Text: Click on the persons play button and listen: How does the person feel today?
meaningfulSection3Banner: 3. Which activity do you suggest for the person?
meaningfulSection3Text:
Based on the person´s mood today, what is important for the person?

When you have taken into account the persons mood, the webbpage will filter the activities by chosen parameters.

Get suitable activities by clicking on the parameters:
meaningfulSection4Banner: 4. Choose and suggest one suitable activity for the person
meaningfulSection4Text1: Choose one activity, that you would suggest for the person. Download the PDF to your computer and submit it to your teacher with your own reflections included (why would you suggest this activity for the person?).
meaningfulSection4Text2: Participate in a workshop where meaningful activities are presented and discussed. Your teacher will give you further information of the date and time for this workshop.
